description: President-elect Donald Trump met with the leaders of the International Longshoremen’s Association on Thursday and voiced support for the dockworkers union that shut East and Gulf coast ports in October and may strike again in just over a month.
title: Trump Backs US Dockworkers Poised to Strike Over Automation

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economy editor Molly Smith looks at the threat deep budget cuts could pose to keeping some market-moving data flowing. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: With Trump Eyeing Cuts, Key Economic Data Could Be Under Threat

description: New York Mayor Eric Adams said he would work with President-elect Donald Trump’s administration to find ways to deport “violent criminals” and allow more cooperation between federal and local law enforcement on immigration.
title: NYC’s Adams Tells Trump Border Czar He’ll Cooperate on Deporting Criminals

description: An Iranian mothership? Alien activity? Overly-dedicated hobbyists?
title: New Jersey Drone Mystery Triggers FBI Probe, Resident Hysteria

description: As liberal-leaning cities gird for potential antagonism from the Trump administration, San Francisco’s incoming mayor is vowing to prioritize local issues over national political battles.
title: San Francisco’s Next Mayor Vows Local Focus While Trump Looms

description: Brazilian lawmakers approved a plan to develop the country’s space industry, providing embattled President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva with a victory as he faces setbacks to his personal and political health.
title: Brazilian Space Industry Gets Boost in Win for Embattled Lula

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Test newsletter

description: Canada is examining the use of export taxes on major commodities it exports to the US — including uranium, oil and potash — if incoming President Donald Trump carries out his threat to impose broad tariffs.
title: Canada Weighs Export Taxes on Uranium, Oil If Trump Starts Trade War

description: Italy is planning a business summit in the Gulf region next month to promote its “Mattei” development and migration plan for Africa.
title: Italy Looks to Gulf States to Boost Funding for Its Africa Plan

description: US President Joe Biden is said to be planning to end Nippon Steel Corp.’s $14.1 billion bid to buy United States Steel Corp. on national security grounds. A Treasury Department letter from August provides the justification.
title: Reasons to Reject US Steel Deal Are Buried in Treasury Letter

description: French President Emmanuel Macron will name a new prime minister on Friday morning via a statement, his office said on Thursday evening.
title: Macron Office Says New Premier to Be Announced Friday Morning

description: Iranian authorities are prosecuting a female singer for live streaming her own performance while defying religious dress codes — the latest sign that women continue to challenge the Islamic Republic as it faces pressure at home and abroad.
title: Iran Prosecutes Woman for Defying Ban on Female Public Singing

description: More than two dozen FBI informants attended the rally that Donald Trump held in January 2021, which preceded a riot at the US Capitol to stop the certification of the presidential election, according to a report by the Justice Department’s internal watchdog.
title: FBI Watchdog Discloses Use of Informants at Jan. 6 Capitol Riot

description: Trump’s economic advisers are considering doubling the state and local tax deduction, a popular — but expensive — tax break that could deliver big savings to many residents of New York, New Jersey, and California.
title: Trump Advisers Consider Raising SALT Write-Off Limit to $20,000

description: France’s outgoing prime minister Michel Barnier learned a hard lesson his successor should also know. There is no placating Marine Le Pen.
title: Le Pen’s Takedown of Barnier Holds Lessons for Next French PM

description: Switzerland and the European Union reached a compromise on immigration, overcoming a major sticking point and potentially paving the way for a new deal on bilateral relations, according to people familiar with the talks.
title: EU, Swiss Reach Immigration Accord, Bringing Broader Deal Closer

description: Former Bank of Canada Deputy Governor Paul Beaudry expects policymakers to cut their key interest rate until it hits at least 2.75%, with the path beyond that point less clear.
title: Ex-Bank of Canada Official Sees Key Rate Hitting 2.75% Soon

description: Keir Starmer will seek to bolster cooperation with the European Union on defense and security early next year when he becomes the first British prime minister since Brexit to attend a meeting of the bloc’s leaders.
title: Starmer Seeks to Bolster UK-EU Defense Ties at Meeting Next Year

description: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos is meeting with Donald Trump next week, the president-elect said Thursday, highlighting his contacts with tech titans, including those with extensive contracts with the US government, in the run-up to his return to the White House.
title: Trump Says Jeff Bezos to Meet With Him Next Week

description: Europe’s tumultuous political backdrop loomed over the monetary policy decision taken by officials in Frankfurt on Thursday, according to Christine Lagarde.
title: Lagarde Laments EU’s ‘Self-Inflicted’ Political Uncertainty

description: Turkey’s spy chief Ibrahim Kalin visited the Syrian capital Damascus on Thursday, TV channel TVNet reported, a rare public appearance by the country’s top intelligence official as world powers jostle for influence in the wake of the fall of Bashar Al-Assad’s regime.
title: Turkish Spy Chief Visits Syria in Rush For Influence After Assad

description: Proceeds from Russian exports are accumulating abroad due to increasing delays in international trade settlements caused by US pressure on financial institutions in countries that remain friendly to the Kremlin.
title: Russian Money Piles Up Abroad Amid Trade Payment Troubles

description: Donald Trump ended his previous term as president with a set of changes billed as streamlining the Defense Department’s cumbersome and costly procedures to develop and buy new weapons.
title: Trump’s 2020 Bid to Speed Pentagon Buying Didn’t Take, GAO Says

description: Russian attacks against Ukraine’s damaged power grid have increased the probability of a catastrophic nuclear accident, according to US and European diplomats at an emergency meeting of the United Nations atomic watchdog.
title: Ukraine Faces Rising Risk of Nuclear Plants Incident, US Warns

description: Donald Trump rang the New York Stock Exchange’s opening bell Thursday, a celebratory moment for the president-elect who was returned to the White House in an election in which the US economy took center stage.
title: Trump Woos Wall Street With Corporate Tax Cuts at NYSE Visit

description: Russia is nearing an agreement with Syria’s new leadership to keep two vital military bases in the Middle East state, a key objective of the Kremlin after the fall of President Bashar al-Assad.
title: Russia Nears Deal With New Syria Leaders to Keep Military Bases

description: When President-elect Donald Trump announced his plan to impose tariffs on goods coming from Canada and Mexico until they stop the flow of migrants and drugs, he said he wanted the countries to “pay a very big price!”
title: No Winners Seen in Trump’s ‘Hugely Destructive’ Energy Tariffs

description: President-elect Donald Trump said he would use US support for Ukraine as leverage against Russia to negotiate an end to the war, in an interview with Time Magazine.
title: Trump Vows to Use Ukraine Aid as Leverage Against Russia

description: Brazil’s President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva was “awake and talking” following a scheduled medical procedure two days after having emergency brain surgery, according to his doctor.
title: Lula Awake After Procedure to Avoid Brain Bleeding, Doctor Says

description: German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius acknowledged Polish criticism that the government in Berlin needs to spend more on its military while reiterating his opposition to joint European Union borrowing to fund defense spending.
title: Germany Rebuffs Latest Polish Plea for Joint EU Defense Debt

description: Lithuania approved a new government led by Prime Minister Gintautas Paluckas amid plans to bolster defense spending in an effort to shore up deterrence against Russia.
title: Lithuania Gets New Government After Tumultous Post-Election Period

description: President Joe Biden has commuted the sentences of almost 1,500 people, the largest one-day act of presidential clemency. He also issued pardons to 39 people convicted of non-violent crimes, several of whom would get lighter sentences if convicted now, the White House announced Thursday.
title: President Biden Commutes Sentences of Nearly 1,500 People

description: China signaled further stimulus measures including raising its budget deficit ratio in 2025 at a key economic meeting that sets policy priorities for the coming year.
title: China Signals More Fiscal Stimulus, Rate Cuts to Lift Growth

description: House prices in Ireland are overvalued by as much as 10% and at risk of a “painful correction,” according to the country’s Economic and Social Research Institute
title: Irish House Prices Are Overvalued by Up to 10%, Says ESRI

description: President Javier Milei achieved something in the past year that many considered impossible: He made Argentines fall out of love with the dollar — for now, at least.
title: Argentines No Longer Love the Dollar, Thanks to Milei

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Xi Flexes Muscles Readying for a Trump Trade War

description: Hungary’s Prime Minister Viktor Orban will meet Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Thursday, the latest in a diplomatic bid to broker a ceasefire in Ukraine that’s made little progress so far.
title: Orban Pursues His Ukraine Peace Mission With Visit to Turkey

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s antitrust picks are likely to take a hard-line on the tech giants, and a harder line on corporate consolidation than the average Republican.
title: Trump’s Antitrust Trio Heralds Big-Tech Crackdown to Continue

description: Mozambique’s Council of State, a group that advises the president, called for “profound” reforms to the way elections take place in the southeast African nation after an Oct. 9 vote triggered an unprecedented wave of deadly violence.
title: Mozambique Presidential Advisory Group Proposes Electoral Reform

description: Denmark seeks to forge closer ties with Southeast Asian nations in a bid to become less dependent on China, Foreign Minister Lars Lokke Rasmussen said.
title: Denmark Moves to Reduce China Reliance by Boosting Malaysia Ties

description: In Gaza and Ukraine, the tab for deterring future aggression may run higher than those of the conflicts.
title: Even If the Wars End, the World Will Pay

description: Romania and Bulgaria will gain full access to the European Union’s passport-free area next year, following a grueling, nearly two-decade push that will help boost their struggling economies.
title: Romania and Bulgaria Win Full Access to Passport-Free EU Area

description: South Korea’s opposition filed a second impeachment motion against President Yoon Suk Yeol on Thursday, with the likelihood of its passage increasing as more ruling party members indicate they will support it.
title: South Korea’s Opposition Files Second Motion to Impeach Yoon

description: The International Monetary Fund is open to renegotiating Ghana’s $3 billion financing program with the incoming administration provided accompanying reforms aren’t jeopardized.
title: IMF Open to Ghana Funding Rework if Reforms Aren’t Derailed

description: Finland stepped in to block two real estate purchases by Russian buyers in the latest move to prevent such deals from turning into threats to its national security.
title: NATO Member Finland Blocks Two Property Sales to Russian Buyers

description: The semi-autonomous region of Puntland is planning a new offensive to combat a growing Islamic State insurgency in Somalia’s mountainous north.
title: Oil-Rich Somali Region Plans New Offensive Against Islamic State

description: Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra pledged to end monopoly in some businesses as she unveiled her administration’s priorities for next year including plans for more cash handout to stimulate Southeast Asia’s second-largest economy.
title: Thai PM Vows to End Business Monopoly, Plans More Cash Stimulus

description: France’s economic outlook is deteriorating as government collapse and the scrapping of its 2025 budget add to months of political upheaval that has already hammered business confidence.
title: France’s Political Impasse Amplifies Economic Challenges

description: Ethiopia and Somalia agreed to lower tensions over a deal that would allow Addis Ababa to build a military base on the coast of the breakaway region of Somaliland in exchange for a stake in its national airline.
title: Ethiopia, Somalia Agree to Resolve Feud in Turkey-Brokered Deal

description: Brian Quintenz has emerged as a top contender to lead the Commodity Futures Trading Commission on what could be a dramatic shift in crypto regulation under President-elect Donald Trump.
title: Andreessen Crypto Policy Lead Quintenz in Running for CFTC Chair

description: Malaysian Deputy Prime Minister Ahmad Zahid Hamidi scored a fresh legal victory Thursday as prosecutors dropped their challenge against his graft acquittal, a development that risks eroding public trust in Anwar Ibrahim’s government.
title: Malaysia Drops Appeal Over Deputy PM Zahid’s Graft Acquittal

description: Canada’s provincial premiers are helping to assemble a list of possible retaliatory measures if President-elect Donald Trump follows through on a threat to apply 25% tariffs against all goods the US imports from its northern neighbor.
title: ‘We Can’t Sit Back’: Canada’s Premiers Float Retaliatory Options Against Trump

description: South Korea’s President Yoon Suk Yeol accused the opposition of trying to paralyze his administration and siding with North Korea in a defiant speech Thursday as the chief of his own party called for his impeachment.
title: South Korean President Remains Defiant as Impeachment Odds Jump

description: The Australian government has signed a confidential agreement with Papua New Guinea, its second security pact in the Pacific in just under a week, in the latest move by the US ally to attempt to contain China’s growing strategic presence in the region.
title: Australia Signs Confidential Security Deal with Papua New Guinea

description: Colombian lawmakers refused to back a government-promoted bill that sought to increase taxes on wealthy individuals, gambling platforms and carbon emissions, potentially forcing the administration to implement painful spending cuts.
title: Colombian Congress Rejects Petro Government’s Tax Increases

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer will today task local UK councils with meeting mandatory housebuilding targets, as he aims to hit his goal of delivering 370,000 new homes per year.
title: UK Pushes Ahead With Planning Reform to Meet Housebuilding Goals
